intro: Psychotria djumaensis var. zambesiaca, commonly known as the Zambesi psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and Southern Africa, particularly in countries like Zambia and Zimbabwe. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. This species is notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
